result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin Lee Otis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be collected by DOC while on Extended Supervision for 13CF1272. Unpaid amount remains due & owing and subject to civil judgment
Consecutive to: to any other sentence with release to the Day Reporting Center

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calvin Lee Otis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter in response to defendant's request to serve sentence in state prison system.
Defendant's letter request to serve sentence in state prison system.

Defendant Calvin Lee Otis in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Calvin Lee Otis in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  

As to Count 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 4 months in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with release to the Day Reporting Center. 

Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges.  Court ordered all monies to be collected by the Department of Corrections from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balances to be paid while on extended supervision for 13CF1272. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Calvin Lee Otis in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned in branch 45.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Calvin Lee Otis in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Defendant Calvin Lee Otis in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Attorney Francisco Araiza in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
Recevied & Filed, Justice Point Violation Report.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed office contact) received and filed. Court will wait to address the violation pending the defendant's appearance at Justice Point on or before 09/08/2015, at which date the defendant would be discharged (per the violation report).

Defendant Calvin Lee Otis in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Morgan Wilz, student intern, under the supervision of Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Calvin Lee Otis not in court, in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record.  Defense requests another status conference date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Calvin Lee Otis not in court, in custody.  Morgan Wilz, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced. State turned over an offer and discovery. Case adjourned for status conference to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walgreens, 2275 North Mayfair R. Milwaukee, WI

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY ORDER.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. 

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Reserve Judge  Br. 45.

Defendant Calvin Lee Otis in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Calvin Lee Otis in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
